1.text: Surely there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they fine it.

2.text: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is molten out of the stone.

3.text: He sets an end to darkness, and searches out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.

4.text: The flood breaks out from the inhabitant; even the waters forgotten of the foot: they are dried up, they are gone away from men.

5.text: As for the earth, out of it comes bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.

6.text: The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it has dust of gold.

7.text: There is a path which no fowl knows, and which the vulture’s eye has not seen:

8.text: The lion’s whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.

9.text: He puts forth his hand on the rock; he overturns the mountains by the roots.

10.text: He cuts out rivers among the rocks; and his eye sees every precious thing.

11.text: He binds the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid brings he forth to light.

12.text: But where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of understanding?

13.text: Man knows not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.

14.text: The depth said, It is not in me: and the sea said, It is not with me.

15.text: It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.

16.text: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.

17.text: The gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.

18.text: No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.

19.text: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.

20.text: From where then comes wisdom? and where is the place of understanding?

21.text: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.

22.text: Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.

23.text: God understands the way thereof, and he knows the place thereof.

24.text: For he looks to the ends of the earth, and sees under the whole heaven;

25.text: To make the weight for the winds; and he weighs the waters by measure.

26.text: When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:

27.text: Then did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yes, and searched it out.

28.text: And to man he said, Behold, the fear of the LORD, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
